title: MG Comet Blackstorm launch soon
description: The MG Comet EV is set to get a Blackstorm edition, marking the first time the company will launch a blacked-out version of one of its EVs. MG Motor India, via its social media account, has shared a teaser confirming the arrival of the blacked-out Comet, hinting at what will be available. Comet Blackstorm to have contrasting red highlights It’s likely to be priced at Rs 8.5 lakh onwards It will be mechanically identical to the standard Comet MG Comet Blackstorm exterior and interior changes Red highlights on the bonnet, wheels, and likely in the cabin Like the Hector and Astor, which have a Blackstorm version, the blacked-out Comet will feature a black exterior with red highlights. One can see in the teaser that the front part of the bonnet, the wheel covers and the front bumper have these highlights. While the teaser doesn’t show it, the Comet Blackstorm’s interior will likely feature black upholstery with red stitching, red highlights on the speakers and AC vents, and ‘Blackstorm’ badges and embroidery. Astor Blackstorm’s interior used for representation only.   Comet Blackstorm price is likely to start at Rs 8.5 lakh The brand has yet to confirm the variants with which the Blackstorm will be available, but MG Motor India usually offers these versions with mid-spec variants. The MG Comet is on sale in three trims – Executive, Excite and Exclusive – and is priced between Rs 7 lakh and Rs 9.84 lakh. Based on the price difference between the Astor Blackstorm and Hector Blackstorm and their standard counterparts, expect Comet Blackstorm prices to start at Rs 8.5 lakh, as the mid-spec Excite costs Rs 8.2 lakh.   The Comet Blackstorm will be mechanically the same as the standard model, powered by the 17.3kWh battery that runs a 42hp, 110Nm electric motor, with an MIDC range of 230km. html:
The Comet Blackstorm will be MG’s first blacked-out EV.

The MG Comet EV is set to get a Blackstorm edition, marking the first time the company will launch a blacked-out version of one of its EVs. MG Motor India, via its social media account, has shared a teaser confirming the arrival of the blacked-out Comet, hinting at what will be available.

  1. Comet Blackstorm to have contrasting red highlights
  2. It’s likely to be priced at Rs 8.5 lakh onwards
  3. It will be mechanically identical to the standard Comet

MG Comet Blackstorm exterior and interior changes

Red highlights on the bonnet, wheels, and likely in the cabin

Like the Hector and Astor, which have a Blackstorm version, the blacked-out Comet will feature a black exterior with red highlights. One can see in the teaser that the front part of the bonnet, the wheel covers and the front bumper have these highlights.

While the teaser doesn’t show it, the Comet Blackstorm’s interior will likely feature black upholstery with red stitching, red highlights on the speakers and AC vents, and ‘Blackstorm’ badges and embroidery.

Astor Blackstorm’s interior used for representation only.

Comet Blackstorm price is likely to start at Rs 8.5 lakh

The brand has yet to confirm the variants with which the Blackstorm will be available, but MG Motor India usually offers these versions with mid-spec variants. The MG Comet is on sale in three trims – Executive, Excite and Exclusive – and is priced between Rs 7 lakh and Rs 9.84 lakh. Based on the price difference between the Astor Blackstorm and Hector Blackstorm and their standard counterparts, expect Comet Blackstorm prices to start at Rs 8.5 lakh, as the mid-spec Excite costs Rs 8.2 lakh.  

The Comet Blackstorm will be mechanically the same as the standard model, powered by the 17.3kWh battery that runs a 42hp, 110Nm electric motor, with an MIDC range of 230km.

All prices, ex-showroom, India
